result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:39 PM - case called.  Defendant Charles Gutierrez appeared by video.  Attorney Kevin D. Musolf appeared by video for Charles Gutierrez.  Attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Ellis - Defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Response by Atty Musolf.  Court questions Defendant.  Responses by Defendant.  Court finds waiver of the preliminary hearing is free and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response. 
Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Bond will continue.
